reasoning: Chronic Chagas' disease measured as prevalence (~110 per 100k in endemic areas, ~6-7 million infected globally). This is a chronic condition without well-defined incidence; prevalence is the appropriate metric. Global average reflects concentration in Latin America.
source: Stanaway JD et al. (2016). The global burden of chagas disease: a systematic review and modelling study. Lancet Infect Dis. 16(11):1270-1281
